job_description:
The Community Center for Education Results (CCER), which supports the Road Map Project initiative, is seeking a Data Scientist to provide education data expertise and analytic skills that center community and boldly lead with race. The Data Scientist will work closely with internal CCER team members and external Road Map Project partners to center students’ experiences in conducting analysis and research, developing dashboards and data tools, and presenting and communicating results that serve to create a more equitable education system for Road Map Project region students.
The Data Scientist is an integral member of CCER’s high-energy Data Team, alongside a Data Strategy Director, Senior Data Analyst, and Data Engineer. The Data Team is part of a larger, integrated team comprised of Research, Communication, and Community and Family Engagement Teams, and also works closely with CCER Impact Teams, students, families, community groups, and other Road Map Project partners.
The team performs mixed-methods research, data science, and develops reporting tools to help answer community questions, examine racial equity, and support advocacy and local continuous improvement eﬀorts to advance racial equity in education systems. CCER maintains a longitudinal education data warehouse that includes de-identiﬁed pre-kindergarten through college student academic data for students who have attended K-12 in any of the seven Road Map Project districts since 2010 (N ~ 400,000), and also collects and maintains data from other external and novel sources (e.g. staﬀ and student survey data, educator data and other school system information).
ABOUT CCER AND THE ROAD MAP PROJECTCCER is a 501(c)(3) nonproﬁt organization established in 2010 to staﬀ and support the Road Map Project—a collective impact initiative to improve student achievement from cradle through college and career in seven King County, Washington school districts: Auburn, Federal Way, Highline, Kent, Renton, (South) Seattle, and Tukwila. Through multisector collaboration with hundreds of organizations and individuals, the Road Map Project aims to increase equitable policies and practices in education systems to eliminate opportunity and achievement gaps, and for 70 percent of the region’s youth to earn a college degree or career credential by 2030.

RStudio creates great software that helps people understand data and make better decisions in real-world applications. Our core offering is an open source data science platform, and we aim to make it available to everyone, regardless of their economic means. We’re a Certified B Corporation®, which means that our open-source mission is codified into our corporate charter.
About the Role
We’re developing a new product currently in a private Beta to support RStudio’s mission of training the next generation of data scientists. We feel that doing good data science is similar to playing the piano: it is a skill that cannot be developed with traditional workshops and online courses alone. We’re helping learners develop their skills with a mentor-led, computer supported learning environment.
We’re organized as a cross-functional team that involves product management, subject matter experts (educators), and engineers. This role will oversee the design, development, and delivery of educational content to students.
We’ve had great success with early customers but we’re still rapidly iterating and experimenting in order to fully realize the product’s potential. Additionally, we have ambitious plans for scaling this product from dozens of users to thousands over the next year and you’ll be an integral part of making that happen. This team has all the excitement of a startup, but with the stability and work-life balance that comes from working at a profitable, mission-driven company.
Things you will own
As Data Science Educator, you will be responsible for helping employed professionals learn to do data science with R. You will:
Write instructional materials for R users, maintaining a schedule that allows 15-20 hours per week of focused writing time. You will develop content for every step of the learning journey, from tutorials and code recipes, to practice exercises supported by gradethis code for automated feedback, to datasets cleaned and curated for students to use, to large scale data science projects that allow clients to apply what they learn as they learn it.
Mentor small groups of adult learners as they complete apprenticeships with R. Each apprenticeship lasts about 12 weeks and guides a group of 5-7 learners through the tutorials, exercises, and projects that you and your team members will create. As a mentor, you will
Facilitate weekly 1 hour online group sessions where students will share their data science project milestones.
Meet with students online each week, in individual or group office hours, collecting questions ahead of time in a Slack or MS Teams channel.
Create a positive, fun, and judgement free learning environment and encourage active participation. Where appropriate, you will provide students with useful feedback and tips on how to improve their R programming.
Things you will help with
You will collaborate frequently with Engineers, Designers, and other Educators to develop infrastructure that supports the learning process. You will have the opportunity to:
Provide product vision for software features, sharing pedagogical principles with your teammates.
Experiment with other mentors to optimize the apprenticeship format.
Review your writing regularly with fellow writers in a supportive and social culture that prizes clear writing.
Help hire additional team members to expand our rapidly growing team.
Things you will bring to the team
Ideal candidates will:
Enjoy helping others reach their goals.
Write clear prose that is a pleasure to read.
Be eager to speak and code in front of students, but prefer to nudge students to try it themselves.
Know R well and like to use the Tidyverse.
Enjoy working in a startup-like environment with lots of autonomy and a strong sense of mission.
Have a strong sense of empathy. You know how to explain technical concepts in a way that others will understand, you know how to make lessons enjoyable, and you can deliver feedback without demoralizing students.
Things we will teach you
It would be a bonus if you knew about these things as well, but we are happy to teach you:
Modern models of how the brain learns, such as Cognitive Load Theory, Multimedia Learning Theory, mastery learning, spaced (or interleaved) practice, and active learning.
Collaborative version control with Git and Github
Enterprise data science, including the basics of: publishing data science artifacts, working in a server environment, selecting architecture for data scientists, customizing deployment methods, connecting to and working with databases, managing packages, and more.
Further data science topics such as Shiny, Tidymodels, Python, and emerging technologies.
About us:
RStudio is a Public Benefit Corporation (PBC) and a Certified B Corporation®, which means that our open-source mission is codified into our charter, and that our corporate decisions balance the interests of the community, customers, employees, and shareholders.
We welcome all talented colleagues and are committed to a culture that represents diversity in all its forms.
We prioritize giving ourselves “focus time” to get deep work done. We minimize meetings and attempt to operate asynchronously.
We are a learning organization and take mentorship and career growth seriously. We hope to learn from you and we anticipate that you will also deepen your skills, influence, and leadership as a result of working at RStudio.
We operate under a unique sustainable business model: We have over 50% of our engineering dedicated to creating free and open source software. We are profitable and we plan to be around decades from now.

Competitive compensation with great benefits including:
medical/dental/vision insurance (100% of premiums covered)

a home office allowance or reimbursement for a coworking space

IT Product Owners will be integral to driving agile methodologies and best practices. The PO will contribute to and drive the strategic direction of data analytics products and identify opportunities to increase business value from growing data repositories. Individuals in this role will be a key steward to help drive insights and be an integral part of the data analytics products delivery team that will continue to inspire a richer data-driven culture.
The Product Owner will influence, educate, and prioritize the data and analytics requirements backlog as well as the strategic decisions to enable the next slate of outstanding experiences for our customers.
A successful candidate will have experience of working in the retail industry, be an effective communicator and have a good understanding of user experience and database technologies.

ROLE
Leads Scrum sprint planning; provides sprint goals and new user stories; gives feedback during the sprint review; drives information and learning in the daily scrum; and reflects and takes action during the sprint retrospective.
Participates in the translation of software features into technical requirements and follows Agile Scrum-based software development.
Shares in the responsibility to maintain a groomed backlog and use effective Agile processes (Scrum and Agile).
Works with stakeholders to identify KPIs and gather data analytics requirements.
Tests reports to ensure optimal user experience and data accuracy.
Adapts to changing business situations and priorities.
Delivers data solutions that result in business value.
Works with business stakeholders to understand processes and documenting requirements.
Works with cross-departmental business partners, Data/BI engineers/ Data Architects/Data Scientists/Platform Engineers, and own the end to end delivery of the data products, which includes documenting and prioritizing user stories; demoing solution designs; testing and releasing changes into a Production environment.
Ensures teams meet their sprint commitments so product deliverables are on time.
Breaks down big problems into small stories that provide value to users.
Partners and works with business stakeholders to define high impact analytical problems and find innovative ways to solve problems with data.
Documents detailed acceptance criteria that developers and QA can rely upon to complete their tasks.
